Editor

Editor is where you design your projects, adding and customizing widgets on each — page as necessary. Your workspace also includes Project Menu (M), in which you can access general settings, overview and rearrange all pages, and work with templates.

Workspace

Creating a project in Editor is similar to designing a layout in Adobe Photoshop or Sketch. You can arrange widgets freely on the page. Any new project is created with a blank page and two default widgets, Background and Grid & Guides, in Widgets panel.

Page

Creating a project in Editor is similar to designing a layout in Adobe Photoshop or Sketch. You can arrange widgets freely on the page. Any new project is created with a blank page and two default widgets, Background and Grid & Guides, in Widgets (Q) panel.

  • Test
  • Create
  • Publish!

Widgets

Positions of your widgets are described in absolute values, and they remain at the exact same place regardless of the screen size. You can move widgets freely around your workspace. By default, each widget should be placedU within the dotted frame to ensure it will appear on all screens.

Operations with Widgets

Creating a project in Editor is similar to designing a layout in Adobe Photoshop or Sketch. You can arrange widgets freely on the page. Any new project is created with a blank page and two default widgets, Background and Grid & Guides, in Widgets panel.

Basic Positioning

Positions of your widgets are described in absolute values, and they remain at the exact same place regardless of the screen size. You can move widgets freely around your workspace. By default, each widget should be placedU within the dotted frame to ensure it will appear on all screens.

Widget controls

Widget controls appear on the right side of the workspace each time you click one of the widgets. Slightly varying for different types of widgets, this panel contains all attributes of the widget. Most common operations allow you to:

  • Adjust widget settings
  • Rotate the widget
  • Add animation
  • Scale to original size
  • Lock the widget
  • Group / Ungroup several widgets
  • Align widgets on the page
  • Position, fix, and 'stick' your widgets
  • Arrange widgets above each other
  • Turn widget into a link
